Prepayment Provisions
A partial or full repayment of principal in excess of the scheduled principal repayments
required by the mortgage is referred to as a prepayment. If a homeowner sells her home
during the mortgage term (a common occurrence), repaying the remaining principal
is required and is one type of prepayment. A homeowner who refinances her mortgage
prepays the remaining principal amount using the proceeds of a new, lower interest rate
loan. Some homeowners prepay by paying more than their scheduled payments in order
to reduce the principal outstanding, reduce their interest charges, and eventually pay off
their loans prior to maturity.
